page.title: List of Korn member solo projects

revision.comment: Rescuing 3 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.1)
revision.text:
Most of the members of the [[nu metal]] band [[Korn]] have their own solo projects of various genres.
==[[Fear and the Nervous System]]== '''Fear and the Nervous System''' is an [[experimental rock|experimental]], [[industrial rock]] band formed by [[James Shaffer|Munky]] in 2008.<ref>[http://fearandthenervoussystem.com FEAR AND THE NERVOUS SYSTEM official site on Emotional Syphon Recordings WEBSITE LAUNCHING SOON<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110710233028/http://www.fearandthenervoussystem.com/ |date=2011-07-10 }}</ref>
;Members: *James Christian Shaffer – [[guitar]]s, [[singing|vocals]], [[Record producer|production]]
;Other contributors: *[[Billy Gould]] – [[Bass guitar|bass]] *[[Zac Baird]] – [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]], [[Programming (music)|programming]] *[[Leopold Ross]] – [[Programming (music)|programming]], [[guitar]]s, [[record producer|production]] *[[Brooks Wackerman]] – [[drum kit|drums]], [[percussion instrument|percussion]]
==[[Fieldy]]== [[Reginald Arvizu|Fieldy]] is working on his own bass solo album entitled ''Bassically''. Fieldy stated in an interview that the album is jazz funk fusion, completely instrumental and "nothing like Korn".<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xAlIM99SGt8</ref> "[[A Song for Chi]]", an instrumental collaboration between various [[rock music|rock]] and [[heavy metal music|metal]] musicians, was released under Fieldy's name in August 2009.
==[[Fieldy's Dreams]]== '''Fieldy's Dreams''' is a rap project by Fieldy. The album ''[[Rock'n Roll Gangster]]'' was released on January 22, 2002, featuring the [[single (music)|single]] "Are You Talking to Me".
==[[Brian Welch|Head]]== Despite some controversy and a lengthy departure from Korn, [[Brian Welch|Head]] has recorded his own solo album entitled ''[[Save Me from Myself (album)|Save Me from Myself]]''. It was released back in 2008, three years after his departure from the band. "[[Flush (Brian Welch song)|Flush]]" and "Re-Bel" were released as singles. In February 2012, Welch announced that he was re-branding his solo project [[Love_and_Death_(band)|Love And Death]].
==[[JDevil]]== [[JDevil]] (also [[J Devil]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dimmak.com/artist/j-devil/|title= JDevil|accessdate= 2010-10-20|work=[[Dim Mak Records]]}}</ref> ([[Jonathan Davis]] of [[Korn]] and [[Jonathan Davis and the SFA]] fame) is the EDM (electronic dance music) producer, DJ alter-ego of [[Jonathan Davis]]
==[[Jonathan Davis and the SFA]]== '''Jonathan Davis and the SFA''' is an [[experimental rock]] project formed by [[Jonathan Davis]] in 2007. Jonathan wanted to do a solo tour ever since he wrote the songs for the 2002 film, ''[[Queen of the Damned (film)|Queen of the Damned]]'', he was finally able to do so which in turn formed this project.<ref>[http://myspace.com/jonathandavisandthesfa MySpace.com - Jonathan Davis and the SFA - US - Experimental / Rock / Fusion - www.myspace.com/jonathandavisandthesfa<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
;Members: *Jonathan Davis – vocals, multi-instruments *[[L. Shankar|Shenkar]] – vocals, double-[[violin]] *[[Wes Borland]] – guitars *[[Miles Mosley]] – [[upright bass]] *[[Zac Baird]] – keyboards *[[Ray Luzier]] – drums, percussion
==[[Killbot (band)|Killbot]]== [[Killbot (band)|Killbot]] is an American [[electronic dance music]] trio formed in January 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dimmak.com/artist/killbot/|title=Killbot|accessdate=2012-10-20|work=[[Dim Mak Records]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116053641/http://www.dimmak.com/artist/killbot/|archivedate=2013-01-16|df=}}</ref> The lineup includes [[JDevil]] ([[Jonathan Davis]] producer, DJ alter-ego),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dimmak.com/artist/j-devil/|title= JDevil|accessdate= 2010-10-20|work=[[Dim Mak Records]]}}</ref> [[Tyler Blue]], and Sluggo (Nick Suddarth).
==Sexual Gyrations of the Universe== '''Sexual Gyrations of the Universe''' is Jonathan Davis and Korn back-up vocalist [[Kalen Chase]]'s side project. Jonathan previewed some songs from the project on his live [[webcast]] off of his official website. Working titles include "Anal Butterfly" and "Bi-Sex". It is currently unknown if anything from this project will be released to the public.<ref>http://jdsfa.com {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080914201831/http://www.jdsfa.com/ |date=2008-09-14 }}</ref>
;Members: *Jonathan Davis - [[vocals]], multi-instruments *[[Kalen Chase]] - vocals, multi-instruments
==[[StillWell]]== '''StillWell''' is a [[rapcore]] collaboration between [[rapper]] [[Q-Unique]] and Fieldy formed in early 2006. They put out their first single, "Killing Myself to Live", in October 2007. StillWell's first album ''Dirtbag'' was be released on May 10, 2011.
;Members: *Q-Unique – vocals *Fieldy – guitars, production *Sleeve – guitars *Chiva – bass *[[Noah Bernardo|Wuv]] – drums
==References== {{reflist}}
{{korn}}
[[Category:Korn solo projects| ]] [[Category:Music-related lists|Korn member solo projects]]

revision.comment: /* Contemporary museum of calligraphy Timeline */ Fix cite date error
revision.text:
{| class="infobox" style="width: 25em; font-size: 90%; margin: 0 0 1em 1em; clear: right; text-align:left" |- | colspan="2" style="text-align: center; background:#eee;" | '''''Contemporary museum of calligraphy''''' |- style="vertical-align: top;" |colspan="2" style="text-align: center; background:#eee;" |[[File:Calligraphy museum photo.jpg|300px]] |- style="vertical-align: top;" | colspan="2" style="padding: 1em 0; text-align: center;" | |- style="vertical-align: top;" |style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" | '''Established''' | style="padding-right: 1em;" | August 14, 2008 |- style="vertical-align: top;" |style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" | '''Location''' | style="padding-right: 1em;" | 2, bld. 1, 5 Luchevoy prosek, Moscow, 107114, MEC Sokolniki |- style="vertical-align: top;" |style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" |'''Getting here''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" | Sokolniki metro station |- style="vertical-align: top;" |style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" | '''Director''' | style="padding-right: 1em;" | Alexey Shaburov |- style="vertical-align: top;" |style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" |'''Tel.:''' |style="padding-right: 1em;" |+7 495 728 7758 |- style="vertical-align: top;" | style="text-align: right; background:#eee;" |'''Website''' | style="padding-right: 1em;" | [http://calligraphy-museum.com/eng/default.aspx/ http://www.calligraphy-museum.com] |}
'''The Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy''', dedicated to the art of calligraphy, is situated in [[Sokolniki Park]], Moscow. The museum collection features calligraphy masterpieces from 43 countries. The concept was elaborated by Sokolniki Exhibition and Convention Centre and the National Union of Calligraphers.
The Museum was officially opened on August 14, 2008.
Contemporary museum of calligraphy<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.moscovery.com/contemporary-museum-of-calligraphy/|title=About the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy in Moscow|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> is a member of [[International Council of Museums|International Council of Museums (ICOM)]], [[American Alliance of Museums|American Alliance of Museums (AAM)]] and European Museum Forum (EMF). The exhibitions, organized by the museum, are supported be the Ministry of Culture of Russian Federation and are granted the auspices . In 2009 the museum's project [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] was approved by [[Union des Foires Internationales|UFI]] (Global Association of the Exhibition Industry) for high professional level of exhibitions organization.<ref>[http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=467 "High estimate of the Global Association of the Exhibition Industry UFI"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110708112104/http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=467 |date=2011-07-08 }}, Official site of the project, 25-11-2009</ref> In 2010 the project entered the final three of exhibitions World Cup according to Exhibition News Awards (London).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=444 |title=We made it to the finals!-International Exhibition of Calligraphy |publisher=Calligraphy-expo.com |date=2010-03-23 |accessdate=2014-04-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120723165419/http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=444 |archivedate=2012-07-23 |df= }}</ref> In 2010 the [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] was certified by Russian Union of exhibitions and fairs (RUEF).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=1503 |title=The RUEF certificate was granted!-International Exhibition of Calligraphy |publisher=Calligraphy-expo.com |date=2011-02-03 |accessdate=2014-04-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219145326/http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/News.aspx?ItemID=1503 |archivedate=2014-02-19 |df= }}</ref>
The engaged initiator and the director of the museum is Alexey Shaburov, the President of Museum-educational complex Sokolniki.
== Contemporary museum of calligraphy Timeline == [[File:3 Парк Сокольники сегодня.jpg|thumb|Museum is situated in one of the most beautiful places of Moscow - park Sokolniki]] [[File:The museum starts.jpg|thumb|The museum's start]] [[File:The first day of the calligraphy museum in moscow.jpg|thumb|The solemn opening ceremony]] [[File:Alexey shaburov project director.jpg|thumb|Alexey Shaburov, Director of the Contemporary museum of calligraphy]]
'''August 14, 2008'''—the opening day of the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
'''September 16–21, 2008'''—The I [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] (Repin State Academic Institute of Painting Sculpture and Architecture, Saint Petersburg).
'''December 9–14, 2008''' — the exhibition “Mystery world of calligraphy”
'''December 12, 2008''' — the museum shows the first and only handwritten Constitution of Russian Federation. The author is [[Petr Chobitko]], the Chairman of the National Union of Calligraphers. Today this unique exhibit is still in the museum.
'''March 26, 2009''' — master-class of famous Japanese calligraphers Sashida Nakefusa and Hirose Shoko.
'''April 14–19, 2009''' — festival of Japanese culture “Sakura” in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
'''May 18, 2009''' — the Contemporary museum of calligraphy become a member of the [[International Council of Museums|International Council of Museums (ICOM)]].
'''May 22, 2009''' — the museum gets the auspice of the [[UNESCO]] RF Committee.
'''May 23, 2009''' — the Day of [[Russian culture|Slavonic culture]].
'''June 3, 2009''' — the museum takes part in the 11th Moscow International Museum Festival “Intermuseum-2009”.
'''June 30, 2009''' — the museum starts the contest “Holy Script in Calligraphy”
'''July 8, 2009''' — at G8 summit Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi holly presented to the Russian President Dmitry Medvedev the Russian national anthem written by hand and beautifully illuminated. This work was created by The museum was asked by Marilena Ferrari-FMR publishing house to perform this Russian national anthem. So, a member of the National Union of Calligraphers Evgeny Drobyazin and an Italian calligrapher Barbara Calzolary, whose works are also displayed in the museum, created this anthem.
'''August 14, 2009''' — Museum’s birthday. The museum gets new exhibit — the World largest Mezuzah<ref name="guinnessworldrecords1">{{cite web|url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/records-3000/largest-mezuzah/ |title=Largest mezuzah |publisher=Guinnessworldrecords.com |date=2004-05-19 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref> written by a famous Israeli calligrapher Avraham Borshevsky. This scroll is by right included into the [[Guinness Book of World Records]].
'''September 23, 2009''' — the museum gets a greeting letter from Kirill Patriarch of Moscow and All Rus.
'''October 14 — November 14, 2009''' — II [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] (Museum- educational complex Sokolniki, Moscow). A world-famous calligrapher, a member of the [[UNESCO]] international jury on distribution of art awards Nja Mahdaoui comes to the exhibition and gives some master-classes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rt.com/art-and-culture/beauty-word-calligraphy-masterpieces/ |title=Beauty of a word: calligraphy masterpieces in Moscow — RT Art & culture |publisher=Rt.com |date=2009-10-12 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
'''November 25, 2009''' — the project of the museum [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] are approved by [[Union des Foires Internationales|UFI]] (Global Association of the Exhibition Industry) for high professional level of exhibitions.
'''March 23, 2010''' — the project [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] becomes a finalist of exhibitions World Cup according to Exhibition News Awards (London).
'''March 26—28, 2010''' — the Days of Japanese culture in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
'''May 27—28, 2010''' — the Days of Slavonic culture in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
'''July 8, 2010''' — the museum becomes a member of the [[American Alliance of Museums|American Association of Museum (AAM)]].
'''August 1, 2010''' — the museum becomes a member of the European Museum Forum (EMF).
'''September 10–12, 2010''' — III [[International Exhibition of Calligraphy]] (he territory of Yaroslav’s Court, Vilikiy Novgorod). 37 000 visitors for 3 days.
'''November 17, 2010''' — a one-day exhibition of the birch-bark manuscripts and the Four Gospels from the Novgorod State United Museum-Reserve are held.
'''November 18, 2010''' — the opening ceremony of the National School of Calligraphy, initiated by the Contemporary museum of calligraphy. The main professor is a member of the National Union of Calligrapohers '''Yury Koverdiaev'''.
'''February 3, 2011''' — the projects of the museum are approved by Russian Union of exhibitions and fairs (RUEF).
'''February 14, 2011''' – St.Valentine’s Day. Calligraphers sign Valentine cards.
'''March – May, 2011''' – At weekends the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy accommodates chamber concerts of classic music.
'''March 27, 2011''' – The days of the Korean Script, Kim Jong Chil personally conducted a tour around the museum and a workshop.
'''March 29–30, 2011''' – Japanese Culture Days at the museum. Workshops conducted by Japanese calligraphers Sashida Takefusa and Hirose Shoko.
'''June 1, 2011''' – Calligraphy Fest dedicated to the International Children’s Day.
'''October 16, 2011''' – A new season was marked by a series of master-classes.
'''April 8, 2012''' – The Day of the Slavic Eastern Egg, a celebration on Easter Eve, dedicated to painted egg tradition.
'''May 21, 2012''' – The Day of the Slavic Script at the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy.
'''November 1 – December 15, 2012''' – The IV International Exhibition of Calligraphy, took place at the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy, Moscow, traditionally featuring lectures and workshops by Russian and foreign calligraphy masters. Its distinctive characteristic was the shape-shifting exposition that had been totally changed several times during the event<ref>{{cite web|author=Время |url=http://www.m24.ru/videos/5031 |title=Москва 24 - В "Сокольниках" открылась четвертая международная выставка каллиграфии - Сетевое издание М24 |publisher=M24.ru |date=1970-01-01 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mosobltv.ru/?an=news_page&uid=27395 |title=Телеканал Подмосковье - В Сокольниках открылась выставка каллиграфии |publisher=Mosobltv.ru |date= |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
'''March 15–21, 2013''' – Korean Calligrapher Kim Jong Chil's Solo Exhibition<ref>{{cite web|author=Время |url=http://www.m24.ru/videos/14314 |title=Москва 24 - "Афиша": В парке "Сокольники" предлагают почитать Пушкина на корейском - Сетевое издание М24 |publisher=M24.ru |date= |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
'''April 3-7, 2014''' – Russia-Asia art exhibition featuring calligraphy masterpieces from China, Japan, Korea, Israel and other countries
'''September 12, 2014 – October 12, 2014''' – V. Shapovalov's personal exhibition “Calligraphy, Water and Occasion”
'''November 14-30, 2014''' – typographer expert, designer, calligrapher, art history Ph. D. and professor, Georgy Kozubov’s exhibition to celebrate the artist’s 75<sup>th</sup> birthday.
'''March 14 – April 12, 2015''' – 90 calligraphers from over 50 countries took part in the 5<sup>th</sup> International Exhibition of Calligraphy held in Moscow in the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy, and designed around the Contemplation of the Motherland theme.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.m24.ru/galleries/vystavki/17032015/3382|title=В "Сокольниках" открылась Международная выставка каллиграфии|work=m24.ru|access-date=2018-11-16|language=ru}}</ref>
'''May 5-17, 2015''' – Calligraphy of the Great Victory exhibition to celebrate the 70<sup>th</sup> anniversary of the Great Patriotic War victory.
'''December 2-30, 2016''' – Calligraphy about Moscow exhibition.
'''September 1-10, 2017''' – The opening of the 6th International Exhibition of Calligraphy highlighted the beginning of the autumn cultural season in Moscow.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://vm.ru/news/412659.html?from=sm2|title=Каллиграфы выставили свои работы в парке «Сокольники»|work=Вечерняя Москва|access-date=2018-11-16|language=ru}}</ref>
'''May 9-31, 2018''' – a calligraphy exhibition to celebrate the Great Patriotic War victory day.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://ria.ru/sn_volunteers/20180503/1519810638.html|title=Волонтеры напишут письма ветеранам ВОВ в музее каллиграфии|date=2018-05-03|work=РИА Новости|access-date=2018-11-16|language=ru}}</ref>
== Museum innovations == * First and still the only museum of contemporary calligraphy art in Russia. * The exposition is formed according to principals of visual perception. * The museum is a kind of art-workshop. People are gathering to discuss art questions, to communicate with calligraphers, to change their own art experience, to take part in collective art-making.
== Museum activity == {{calligraphy}} {{See also|International Exhibition of Calligraphy}}
I International Exhibition of Calligraphy was held in Saint Petersburg in 2008. 68 participants from 26 countries took part in this exhibition<ref>[http://peterburg2.ru/news/927.html ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110824084342/http://peterburg2.ru/news/927.html |date=August 24, 2011 }}</ref>
II International Exhibition of Calligraphy was held in Museum-educational complex Sokolniki in Moscow in 2009. More than 100 calligraphers from 33 countries. The exhibition halls’ total area is about 5 000 sq.m.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ntv.ru/novosti/178023/ |title=Священное искусство письма // НТВ.Ru |publisher=Ntv.ru |date=2009-10-14 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
III International Exhibition of Calligraphy was held in Velikiy Novgorod in 2010. For this exhibition a special pavilion was built in the city historic centre near the Kremlin in Yaroslav’s Court. 109 calligraphers from 43 countries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/Reports/VideoReports.aspx?ItemID=1117 |title=Vesti (News Hour) – Veliky Novgorod on Russia 1 TV Channel. September 13, 2010-International Exhibition of Calligraphy |publisher=Calligraphy-expo.com |date=2010-09-13 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
The IV International Exhibition of Calligraphy at the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy, Moscow, attended by 178 calligraphers from 43 countries (footnotes 10-11).
The 5<sup>th</sup> International Exhibition of Calligraphy was held in the Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy in Moscow. The anniversary event featured 90 calligraphers from 52 countries, which presented 201 calligraphy works.
A dedicated exhibit hall was erected for the 6<sup>th</sup> International Exhibition of Calligraphy in Sokolniki. A record in scale and scope, the event featured over 350 works by 150 calligraphers from over 60 countries. The agenda was no less eventful, including Kim Jong Chil’s calligraphy performance, Luo Lei’s talk and demonstration of the Chinese writing development history, Bilibin’s Style Capital workshop by Marina Khankova and more.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.m24.ru/articles/vystavki/29082017/150475|title=150 мастеров раскроют секреты каллиграфии на выставке в "Сокольниках"|work=m24.ru|access-date=2018-11-16|language=ru}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ug.ru/guest/454|title=Красота по-русски|website=www.ug.ru|language=en|access-date=2018-11-16}}</ref>
The common number of visitors of these three big events is about 84 000.
<gallery perrow="3" widths="200px" heights="150px"> File:Petr Chobitko.JPG|Calligrapher [[Petr Chobitko]], opening ceremony of the I International exhibition of calligraphy File:The openning ceremony in the museum of calligraphy.jpg|The opening ceremony of the Mystery of the world calligraphy exhibition File:Calligraphy in v novgorod 2.jpg|III International exhibition of calligraphy, exhibition pavilion on the bank oh the Volkhov river </gallery>
* '''''Cultural Festivals and Events'''''
April 14–19, 2009 — festival of Japanese culture “Sakura” in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://calligraphy-expo.com/rus/about/Reports/VideoReports.aspx?ItemID=1167 |title=Телеканал "Россия" — программа "Вести — Москва", 14 апреля 2009 г.-Международная выставка каллиграфии |publisher=Calligraphy-expo.com |date=2009-04-14 |accessdate=2014-04-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140413141343/http://calligraphy-expo.com/rus/about/Reports/VideoReports.aspx?ItemID=1167 |archivedate=2014-04-13 |df= }}</ref>
March 26—28, 2010 — the Days of Japanese culture in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
May 23, 2009 and May 27—28, 2010 — the Days of Slavonic culture in the Contemporary museum of calligraphy.
* '''''Master-classes'''''
The Contemporary museum of calligraphy regularly organizes master-classes of Russian calligraphers and famous masters of writing art from abroad.
As the link between calligraphy and other kinds of art is very close, the museum cooperates with the artists, musicians, poets and other people of art for organization of little events.
* '''''The National School of Calligraphy'''''
The School was open on November, 2010. The School’s aim is to show people what calligraphy art is, explore the history of different fonts, teach to use different pens, give basics of beautiful writing. The senior professor is Yury Koverdyaev, graphic artist, calligrapher, member of Russian Union of Artists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/about/Reports/VideoReports.aspx?ItemID=1681 |title=Kultura (Culture) TV-channel – Culture News (News Hour). November 17, 2010 -International Exhibition of Calligraphy |publisher=Calligraphy-expo.com |date=2010-11-17 |accessdate=2014-04-12}}</ref>
<gallery perrow="3" widths="200px" heights="150px"> File:School's everyday life.jpg|School's everyday life File:Calligraphic free-lesson fpr kids.jpg|Calligraphy lesson for children File:Lesson of Japanese calligrapher.jpg|Master-class of Japanese calligraphers Sashida Takefusa and Hirose Shoko </gallery>
== Exposition == The museum has the world's largest and most comprehensive collection of national [[Russian language|Russian calligraphy]], [[Phoenician alphabet|European writing systems]], samples of [[Hebrew alphabet|Hebrew calligraphy]], colorful [[Arabic alphabet|Arabic calligraphy]], ancient [[Georgian calligraphy]], strict [[Japanese language|Japanese hieroglyphs]] and ancient [[Chinese language|Chinese calligraphy]]. These art creations reveal to a man the [[Historical linguistics|history and continuous development of world writing systems]]. Calligraphy art pieces are added by rare handwritten books, [[pen]]s and [[writing implement]]s.
Museum’s holdings include over 4000 unique calligraphy works dating back to the 20<sup>th</sup> – early 21<sup>st</sup> century, created by 450 renowned artists from 65 countries.
'''The most famous exhibits in the Museum are:''' * Handwritten Constitution of the Russian Federation * Decalogue (Ten Commandments) * The World famous Mezuzah<ref name="guinnessworldrecords1"/> * Sacral calligraphy collection
'''''Samples of sacred calligraphy'''''
<gallery perrow="3" widths="250px" heights="250px"> File:Chobitko-Sins.jpg| '''''Petr Chobitko'''''. "Remember not the sins of my youth and ignorance of mine…" Psalms 25:7 File: Nassar Mansour. "This day let no reproach be (cast) on you…" Surah 12 (Yusuf), verse 92.jpg| '''''Nassar Mansour'''''. "This day let no reproach be (cast) on you…" Surah 12 (Yusuf), verse 92 File: Avraham Borshevsky Remember not the sins of my youth.jpg|'''''Avraham Borshevsky'''''. "Remember not the sins of my youth...". Psalms 25:7 </gallery>
The Contemporary museum of calligraphy is a new and unique institution that unites [[painting]], [[graphics]] and [[writing]].
Apart from its permanent exposition the Museum is the official organizer of the International exhibition of calligraphy.
The Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy is located at Pavilion 7 of the Museum-educational complex Sokolniki.
== References == <references />
== Calligraphy museums == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090830062337/http://www.calligraphy-museum.com/index_en.php Contemporary museum of calligraphy] * [http://www.schriftmuseum.at Bartlhaus] * [http://www.hmml.org Hill Museum & Manuscript Library] * [http://www.rain.org/~karpeles/ The Karpeles Manuscript Library] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141019061047/http://www.manuscriptcenter.org/museum/ Manuscript Museum (MsM)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090408081601/http://www.naritakanko.jp/naritashodo/ Naritasan Calligraphy museum] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090614123518/http://www.vam.ac.uk/collections/prints_books/prints_books/modern_calligraphy/index.html The Modern Calligraphy Collection of the National Art Library at the Victoria and Albert Museum] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090821101458/http://www.ditchling-museum.com/index.html Ditchling Museum] * [http://www.klingspor-museum.de/UeberdasMuseum.html Klingspor Museum] * [http://muze.sabanciuniv.edu/main/default.php?bytLanguageID=2 Sakip Sabanci Museum]
== Calligraphy exhibitions == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20130628102548/http://calligraphy-expo.com/eng/default.aspx International Exhibition of Calligraphy] * [http://bangalore.metblogs.com/2008/04/30/calligraphy-exhibition-at-ethos-art-gallery/ Calligraphy Exhibition at Ethos Art Gallery] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20100212021324/http://www.japancalligraphy.eu/ru/sumi-e/exhibition.htm Japanese calligraphy exhibition]
== World calligraphy association == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090925180149/http://www.calligraphy-union.ru/index.php?lang=english National Union of Calligraphers] * [http://www.calligraphicarts.org/ Association for the Calligraphic Arts] * [http://www.northwestcalligraphers.org.uk/ North West Calligraphers’ Association] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20000819054339/http://www.yale.edu/calligraphy/ The Chinese Calligraphy Association] * [http://www.calligraphersguild.org/ The Washington Calligraphers Guild] * [http://www.calligraphers.com/florida/ Calligraphy Society of Florida] * [http://www.iampeth.com/ The International Association of Master Penmen, Engrossers and Teachers of Handwriting IAMPETH] * [http://www.bleu.net/esperluette/ L’esperluette] * [http://www.articalligrafiche.it/ Centro Internazionale Arti Calligrafiche] * [http://www.calligraphy.ie/ Peannairi (Irish Scribes)] * [http://www.calligrafia.org/ Associazione Calligrafica Italiana (ACI)] * [http://www.meitokai.com/ Meitokai] * [http://www.clas.co.uk/ Calligraphy & Lettering Arts Society]
== What the press says == * [http://www.diplomatrus.com/article.php?id=1731&l=eng The Diplomat magazine]{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}. ''Treasures of Calligraphy, 1.2009''
<center><blockquote>The museum was created in order “to provide the conditions for developing calligraphy as a language of mutual understanding without borders.”</blockquote></center> * [https://web.archive.org/web/20111008075538/http://www.mos-ps.ru/ru/news/index.php?id4=8465 Mospress. Official web-portal of the Moscow government] - ''available in Russian''
<center><blockquote>Similar museums have been long working in Turkey, China, Japan and United Arab Emirates. It is by a very strange chance that Russia did not have any calligraphy museum before.</blockquote></center> * [http://www.rian.ru/culture/20080730/115226527.html RIA Novosti] - ''available in Russian''
<center><blockquote>Contemporary Museum of Calligraphy is the first Russian museum for the art of lettering.</blockquote></center>
